PHX also offers ample variety of restaurants, lounges, gift shops and other retailers. 

Restrooms are very nicely decorated and very tidy/clean.

Staff, for the most part, are friendly. There are a few working in the gift shops who probably shouldn't be a Cashier in a busy airport. They were pretty irritated and crabby.

Also, would LOVE to have better signage for Terminals, etc. Or maybe it's just me? I always feel I'm frantically crossing 3-4 lanes of traffic at the last minute. Maybe I need my eyes checked.
Great airport and easy to figure out.  The WiFi was free and very fast. Streaming music along with videos was a breeze. Overall great time at this airport. SIMPLE!
Seems very clean, lots of variety in food and shopping, both before and after security.
It's a little confusing to get out once you are there, but aside from that it is really nice.

PHX is a very good airport its just the right size, easy to navigate, and not long lines. My experience was good except for a rude Delta employee, and a rude TSA agent yelling at the Pre -Check passengers, myself included. The food options in terminal 3 were minimal just a Starbucks and a Wendy's. Taking a morning flight out of PHX is a big plus because the sunrise is amazing especially when taxing to the runway (great photo-op)!

They tout themselves as "America's Friendliest Airport".  

This is like going to a restaurant and getting the "World Famous Cheesecake" or the like.  You've all seen it...the menu amps it up but it never delivers.  This is PHX.

All I saw were golf carts honking at me and a restaurant kitchen manager that addressed it's bar staff as "bartenders", gave a 1h warning of the kitchen closing and proceeded to close 5 minutes after that anyway.

Perhaps it is friendly, just not to me this trip.

Large airport, but it is nice and airy, very clean and pretty easy to get to your gates. 

Plenty of food options, TSA were friendly and check-in was pretty simple even though it was Super Bowl Week in Phoenix.

Bag came out after a bit of a wait, but not an abnormal wait.

The ONLY reason for 3 stars instead of 4 is the fact that getting a rental car is a good 1/2 hour (or more) added to your trip time. Buses bring you to the center, but just the ride alone is a good 15-20 minutes. Not efficient at all and highly annoying. The inconvenience factor ranks up there with McCarran in Las Vegas. ADD EXTRA TIME FOR GETTING and RETURNING YOUR RENTAL CAR. You'll be really, really happy you did.

Please put up some helpful signage! 

This airport has very friendly "docents" stationed about who will give you directions to wherever you need to go. It's a nice touch, but maybe the airport realized a badly needed one too, as the current signage is useless! 

Navigating from one terminal to the next is a confusion at best. Finding the train that connects the terminals, then figuring out the direction in which it traveled to my terminal required that I ask three people! All very hospitable folk, no doubt. But I've traveled all over the world so am pretty good at following signs in airports so one would think I could do it in Phoenix too. 

Finally, when traveling from one terminal to the next, I had to exit security, then go through it all over again. This was only a plane change for a connecting domestic flight!

It's Super Bowl Sunday and I just landed in sunny Arizona. There are hundreds of people laying on the floors waiting for their flight delays to be lifted. Not many staff on hand at airport to assist people. On the other hand I had a wonderful Southwest flight in.

As far as air travel goes, Phoenix Sky Harbour is one of the better airports I've flown through.  I haven't experienced many lineups or delays. There is limited shopping but a wide selection of restaurants and services. 

My only complaint would be that there is no Starbucks in whichever terminal (3???) WestJet flies out of.

This airport is fairly large, it is nice but could use some more AC because it's pretty hot inside, very clean and pretty easy to get to your gates. 

So as soon as I landed and got out of the plane, I had to meet up with the rest of the ladies who arrived earlier than I did to Terminal 3. It was quite a long walk and it was so cool to take the tram and got to see parts of the airport.

Plenty of food options (I was in Terminal 4), the Starbucks was near my gate so I was happy it wasn't going to be a long walk. The food choices before security line is decent then beyond the security line.. it's just meh.

Overall, it's a decent airport to fly out to and from.
PHX has actually turned into a great airport. They have so many great options for food, and I always get in and through security quickly. Much better than other airports I have been to.

So I don't fly much, but I have come to this airport now four times. Two times just this passed weekend and twice in 2013. I really like this airport. This first time I flew into this airport was on US Airways. The workers are nice, however going back, I  remember, the lady Had me check in my bag so I had to pay I think $35 for it when I didn't need to check it in coming. She had an attitude and I knew didn't want to be there.

This time around I flew with Southwest and their gating area is actually split. It goes C1 to I think C8 was in one area and from C9 to C17 was in another. I'm sorry I forgot how many gates there were, and where it stopped from, but I remember that cuz I was supposed be @ gate C4 and then I got moved to gate C16 which was in another part. Well they have those comfy leather chairs that has outlets connected to them which made my wait time better.

Also getting to terminals 3 & 4 you have to take what they call the train to it. It's short travel time on it. I went on it and it was fun lol. It's all still connected but you do need to take it if need be.

Overall I really like this airport. It's clean and the part of getting to terminals 3 & 4 is new! It's really nice. I actually won't mind having a stop here if need be in my furture travels lol.

Off site rental car sucks but other than that it's a pretty good airport. The terminals are not connected. So if u go thru security, make sure it's the right terminal or u will have to go thru security again.

As with all airports, they are usually pretty similar. I didn't have any terrible experiences here that would drive this down to a two star rating, but there are definitely a few things that make this not a four star.

The format of the airport isn't too crazy, one center lane that connects to various spokes with the gates.  In theory, a decent way to set up an airport, but when transferring, it's quite a hassle.

Okay, I LOVE this airport.  The people are friendly, the layout makes sense and it just seems really well run.  I think from now on, I am going to request going through this airport rather than Denver.  Denver is the crappiest airport of all time...I don't think I have reviewed but will do that and they will get NO STARS.
Anyway, we flew back yesterday (a Saturday) and had no problems.  Also, the fact that they have decent restaurants and shopping (maybe the shopping is more entertaining...rather than decent) in the terminals is a huge plus.  We didn't really have time to 'shop' or look around but I'm almost sure I could have whiled away some time looking at the ethnic pottery, jewelry and t-shirts.  
Love this place.  We actually did have time for breakfast.  Not sure what the name of the bar/restaurant was but I was able to have a little 'End of Vacation Mimosa' before we left.  Yea!

I travel a lot between pleasure and business.

Normally go through here when heading to Scottsdale President's Day for a long weekend- this year have been here twice in a month- for Superbowl and now for President's Day and I have to say- it is one of the cleanest and nicest/simple airports, they have water bottle refill machines, decent food choices.

The Admirals Club (old US Air lounge) in Terminal 4 by gate A20 is VERY small, however, convenient and clean.

Only thing that wish was better was the AC in connecting hallways as gets really warm so if you are in a suit that is not very comfortable.

The good: Terminal 4 is nicely decorated, if largely devoid of natural light (at least in the main pre-Security lobby).

The bad:
* Long bus ride to rental cars, all located off-site. Yes, some other airports have this too, and it's a black mark on them, too.

* Local councilmembers exhorting travelers to shop and dine at the airport. These kind of announcements are totally useless ("Wait, I can eat and shop while I wait for my flight? I never thought of that!") and annoying. They are marginally better than the "be scared, watch out!" announcements at PDX, but just barely.

* Terminal 2: The b*stard stepchild at PHX, it's a long walk in the open (covered, but not enclosed) from the other terminals. It's clear that it hasn't been remodeled since the 1980's, and given that apparently all airlines at T2 are slated to move to T3, it's unlikely an update is likely.

I'll revisit this score if I'm every back and the T2 situation has changed, but the car rental situation is a permanent 2 stars off the score.

Not terrible, but not the ideal airport.

I was flying on a busy morning after a holiday. It took me an hour and a half from the moment I entered the doors to check in, go through security, and get to my gate. That would be a disaster for anyone who is running late, which is usually me, but on this particular occasion I was hours early so I could be zen about it. Lots of people freaking out, though. They simply don't have the capacity for the amount of flights there, especially on Southwest!

The TSA dog was a super cute black lab. Points for that.

There were a good amount of places to charge your phone and my car rental experience at the airport, while far away, was pleasant. I wouldn't recommend renting from there though due to the extra fees unless you have a low rate like I did. Compare, compare! 

I'd fly here again, I guess.

Ok....who yelps an airport??? I guess "this guy" does.  What else ya gonna do at 3:30am and can't sleep??

Like a yelper before me said..."They have planes" and add: greay Admirals Clubs  as well.

But why does my connection always cone into another terminal 45 miles away??
This place seems to some how make life easier you fly in you fly out and u save money. Each terminal is a breeze to get through.

I sometimes connect through here, sometimes I dont.  But this last time I did, I didnt have any problems.  We ended up coming to PHX because US Airways sent us here and said it was "close to Seattle and not in Charlotte"......yea nice logic. 

Airport itself was fine, pretty clean, good amount of food options that I saw from your typical chain places to more of a cool looking burger joints/pubs etc. Free wifi is a plus in my book! Good amount of stores to buy magazines, water and little snacks & souvenirs, gates have tv's to watch (CNN is usually on at all times). Bathrooms are pretty clean, signage isnt the easiest to follow when looking for a specific exit area when you are trying to meet up with a shuttle.  When we were dropped off by the shuttle in the morning, I was looking at the signage as you are driving into the airport, a little confusing with the abbreviations and small signage to direct you to the correct terminals for drop off.  Nice landscaping outside of the airport though.  

US Airways agent here was super helpful and totally understood our situation, gave us a hotel voucher, gave us detailed info on what to do, update on our luggage situation, shuttle info, gate info and made sure all our questions were answered.  Which totally is the opposite of what the US Airways agents said over the 800# and at CLT airport customer service agent said.

I have a soft spot for this airport, mainly because of the classic Jimmy Eat World song. For a large airport that is a hub for both US Air and Southwest, I guess it could be worse. Here is the breakdown:

Arrivals: All of the terminals connect to the main hub. You'll head downstairs for baggage claim and rental cars. If you're picking up someone curbside, be prepared to be frustrated because it's pretty much chaos during busy times.

Departures: If you have a rental car, make sure you arrive extra early to account for taking the shuttle and the long hike to whichever terminal you are flying from. Food options are okay - the airport is slowly moving from boring chains to more local places. The seating areas are usually pretty cramped and outlets can be found (especially in the Southwest terminals) but you're better off preparing for standing and no outlets.

Connections: I always allow at least 45 minutes for a connection here. You may be tricked by thinking your connection is close because it is in the same terminal but there are a few spokes for each terminal so getting from C12 to C1 (for example) requires you to get to the end of your arriving terminal and then head to the other part of the terminal over the length of two moving walkways and then to the end of the next part of the terminal. Hope that paints a pretty enough picture. 

Pro-tips: weather usually isn't an issue here so if you're flying in the winter, this is a good airport to use (just be aware of your connection time!)

The Phoenix airport is a nice size airport, not too small and not overly big.  There are still a decent number of flight options and the prices are reasonable.  I haven't had that much food but the options seem good but not too many choices.

This airport is very spread out.  Unfortunately the gates areas are all spread out making it difficult to get from one area to another.  There are a lot of food options which is nice.  There are also many stores that sell local American Indian/Mexican souvenirs in the center area and in terminal A for reasonable cost.  

Overall a decent airport, but the gates are very bunched and there are limed seats, forcing people to sit on the floor.  There are many outlets to plug in which is nice.
Nice clean efficient airport. Convenient off-airport location for car rental with always-available free shuttles. Baggage claim is always s l o w.
Worst customer service in food and airline it's like the employees don't want to be here!

I've passed through PHX a lot this year, on my way to and from California. Although it is not at the top of my favorite airports list (Portland and Copenhagen take the cake), it isn't the worst place to make a connecting flight.

Some of the best elements are the free wireless, abundant moving walkways (if only people would abide the stand-to-the-right rule), and decent food options (for an airport). Some downsides are that it may take you a while to get to a different gate for your flight, which can be incredibly stressful if your first flight got in late and you're rushing.

Although the airport is busy, there are usually enough seats to go around, except for holiday travel. Unfortunately, I can't speak to TSA there, since I have never entered from the outside.

Not a bad little airport. Nothing to write home about, but getting around it is not hard, as it is smaller than some. It is a bit dark and could use a makeover, but it is serviceable. 

Southwest uses Sky Harbor as a hub, and there are plenty of connecting flights available. 

The bathrooms are clean and there are a few tables with power plugs for your laptop/cell phone devices to charge and work. Still, there needs to be more of them. The Wi-Fi dropped in and out a bit, but I haven't been to this airport often enough to see if it is a long-term problem or just a temporary issue.

The struggle is real at this airport since it's like a hub for connections. 

Master clusters everywhere and delays left and right. 

I've been stuck here a couple times while waiting for a connecting flight and somehow always managed to get sick as well. If you can get a direct flight then don't get a connecting flight here.

If you do get stuck here, there are plenty of places to eat so that's a plus.

People are friendly and went through security without many issue. Can say that getting around from one terminal to another may require a bit of walking but excursive is good :-p Not many choices in restaurants, but airport does offer free wifi

1 hour 10 min to get from one gate to another.   I would have given 1 star but the people were very nice.   The committee that designed this airport however should all have their degrees revoked.   

At the minimum you have to completely exit security if you are going from one airline to another.  Worst case you have to exit and walk a very long way to a train and then go to into a terminal that resembles a shopping mall.  But you don't really know what terminal or gate to go to if it isn't on your boarding pass because the info boards are few and ONLY display for their terminal.   

Having to go BACK through TSA on a simple transfer is terrible.   This is such a bad decision in design that I will actively avoid Phoenix on all future transfers.

Love my beloved Phx Airport but get a wreath, a Christmas tree,  garland, poinsettas, anything to  remind people of the Spirit of Christmas. As a frequent flier i have seen several other airports all decked out in decorations, i would love to see that here!

90% of the time, I fly United. While the gate check process always goes well and I love this quieter terminal, if you're TSA approved you can never count on the lane being open. Today, indeed the check-in line made it all the way to the gate check area! The other issue has been inconsistent baggage claim process, although I am told that the City of Phoenix is partly to blame. There are also times when the line to get any food is so long that one has to do without. Overall, this could be a great smaller terminal but it is not run in a consistent manner.

The bad: This airport appears to be designed by a guy who owns major stock in walkways, half of which don't work or are under repair. 

The good: One trip down and back to kill time on said walkways gets me 2/3 of my daily Fitbit steps goal.

The bad: Restaurants are hit and miss. Seriously hit and miss (Sir Veza's Taco Garage was an unexpected disappointment). 

The good: If you have enough time to hike to the Southwest terminal (or are lucky enough to be in that area already), the food and beer at La Grande Orange make up for every other lame restaurant at the airport.

The bad: Not enough power outlets. 

The good: More steps toward your Fitbit goals as you hunt down the elusive place to juice up your phone.

Unbelievably inept TSA staff! Hugh lines, people missing flights - ZERO SENSE OF URGENCY.  Arrive early and plan to be in the security line for an hour or so. I used to live in Fiji. They were faster! They deserve a minus star rating.
Thanks Phoenix airport for the long wait at the TSA check in.  Due to the long wait we missed our flight!

Flew in and out of Sky Harbor International Airport recently. It feels like a smaller airport - at least the United Terminal does. It was quite crowded while I was there.

Fairly easy to get in and out of.

Security was slow, and no pre check line was available on the morning I flew out .   Was very disappointed that one can't go to another terminal without going out of security, thus having to negotiate security upon returning to original  terminal.   Only airport I've ever been in like that.  Not much to choose from as far as shopping or dining in terminal 2.
They also allow dogs on leash in the terminals.  Now, I am an animal lover, even have a dog myself, however, saw a leashed dog defecate on the carpet near gate 11.  That's just unsanitary.

I flew united on a busy holiday travel day and go through bag check and security in under fifteen minutes. Efficiently working today. terminal 2 is very boring and does not have much for entertainment or even eating.

A little complicated to get in and out of the terminals. I didn't stay there long enough to figure whether there's free wifi or not. But overall, it's a clean airport with very friendly staff, even the TSA staff was very friendly to me.

Omg, this is one the worse airport.  

TSA is super slow, inefficient, 

AIrport itself is very old old old.  Yuck.

It's a really good airport over all but you just have to get in a little earlier than smaller airports like Austin or Richmond. If you're doing the rub run Rudolph dash for your flight, you won't make it here... the gates are farrrrrr. I rated 4 stars because I wish they had more healthy food choices.

0100 arrival for 150 gal of Jet A and a quick turn. Scruffy, unshaven CSA, dressed in ratty hooded sweatshirt did not project a professional image. When asked, there was no change available for a $20.00 bill for vending machine. Not the level of service expected from a high end FBO. We'll make another facility choice next time.

not a bad place to stay. the staff is fairly helpful, but doesn't seem to like their jobs too much. i was greeted with an audible sigh upon check-in like i just interupted a thrilling game of solitaire. the room was clean and comfortable, but this IS by the airport, so bring some earplugs. the "high speed internet" they advertise and offer is nothing but wireless dial-up at best. but...the price is right, and there is a cool bar/lounge next door.

2/29/08 - I left some dress shirts in my room upon checkout, and when I got back to California, I called them, and they sent them out UPS at no charge!

So not worth it.  Front desk staff had an attitude.  Did not care we were part of the Best Western membership award program (not right tier I guess!). The room was so so and the staff did not make me want to feel better about it.

I will give a bit of a shout out to the restaurant that is adjoining but not affiliated.  Nice staff and decent food,  (Sam in the bar is great).

Had to stay here due to late arrival due to LAX shooting.  We arrived in Phoenix around 7pm and didn't want to drive to Sedona till following day.  Was eating dinner nearby and searching for a hotel with my phone.  This hotel came up and was a good price.  We only needed to sleep here so it was ok.  This was the second BW we stayed at that didn't have breakfast included.
The restaurant is not affiliated with hotel, didn't try restaurant.
There are 2 computers to use free of charge in lobby with a printer.  Didn't get to try the pool.
Also stayed here the night before our flight back home.  This hotel is a short drive back to rental car at airport so thats why we chose this hotel.  They also offer free airport shuttle if needed.
Had free wifi which was nice.
Book online to get best rate.

So after a few visits,  a quick update.  

So the lot is pretty small, so it can sell out, expecially on those must  fly home weekends like Thanksgiving.  Make sure to call the lot before, or make a reservation like a week in advance to secure your place.  

Off peak days and off hour pick up may takes time at least 20 minutes,  so plan accordingly.    Not bad for the free spirit, not so great for your busy bodies.  

The ideal place for the college student saving money for fun, but not so much for the peeps expecting immediate pick up and tvs in on the ride back.

I want to give them 3-stars because of the lady working there, but I really can't complain. $4 a night if reserved online, shuttle arrived within 10 minutes and had us to our terminal in another 10. It was a little confusing pulling in, there's no signage telling people who reserved ahead of time what to do. After we parked, I finally realized there was someone inside. When she saw me she, yelled through the locked door (as I was trying to ask her a question) if I needed the shuttle. The shuttle driver ended up explaining the process of verifying my reservation.

UPDATE: So on the return trip, we just happened to be walking out when the shuttle was pulling up, so no wait. Just make sure you tell the driver you are going to Sundance (Sundance contracts "Sky Harbor Parking" shuttles, and only some of the drivers are designated to go to Sundance). Driver was helpful and polite. Tip them if they're good!

Back at the lot in 5ish minutes, only to discover I had left my interior lights on the past 5 days.... Again, the lady working inside was of no help, and told me that all she could do was "call a shuttle driver and see if they have a box".
Not sure what that means. 
Luckily another family got dropped off as we were walking back to the car, and they were able to jump our car no problem. 

Checkout was easy, I pulled up to the window and handed her my receipt I printed at home, and the the ticket the machine gave me when I pulled in last week. If you follow the directions (not really laid out that well) it's a simple process.

The lady in the office was not helpful at all and didn't even seem to understand anything including the English language. I made a reservation ahead of time online through OneStopParking for parking at Sundance. The woman said they had no record of my reservation - after she asked for my name several times which is an easy name, nonetheless, she could have just asked me for my ID instead of asking for my name almost 5 times. Then she asked me to email her my reservation which I did and she kept asking me what my rate was. I had a receipt that said I would owe $32 total for my parking fee. Plus side is the shuttle drivers know what they are doing and are very convenient. When I checked out, they said I owed $42 which is $10 more than the prepaid parking I had arranged = and no, I did not use any additional time = my flights were on time and I actually had my car parked there less time than I had booked for myself at the $32 rate. Very disappointed with this company, I hope they either get their act together or go out of business. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS when I asked them to refund my $10. Thanks a ton stupid parking Nazis.

I called them to help me with my Travel needs and I let her know that i was A Platinum  American Express Member and it went down hill from there... RUDE ... She Didn't want to help me at all .. SO i didn't let her !

For the sake of convenience, I took a shuttle between Phoenix and Tucson. Booking the trip is easy enough, you can pick a time and pay online. Don't expect anything fancy, if anything the atmosphere is a little bit TOO casual.

I boarded from terminal 2 at Sky Harbor airport, and had to ask around to find the check-in desk. The website only offered a general area, with a photo of the desk. It had a map of the airport, but a little marker to show their location would be nice. Someone got a little bit lazy there.

Anyways, the shuttle was a little cramped, but I won't complain, as I'm 6'4". Most of you will be pretty comfortable. My only problem with it was the waiting area coming back from Tucson. It was at a gas station with no desk, just a sign in front of a dumpster in the back that basically said to wait at a bench and the driver will have your receipt when he arrives. 

I'll try not to rant. This shuttle service will get you where you need to go in a timely fashion. What else is there to expect?

Quick edit: Price from Phoenix to Tucson is $34 in advance, $40 same day, each way.

I use them all the time because there are no alternatives at a reasonable rate.  They are almost always late, so don't book a shuttle for 12:30 and expect to be in Tucson by 2:30 as advertised.  It will be more like 3:30 or even later.  They really push for adding gratuity but their service is just standard, nothing impressive.  I'm sitting at their waiting area in terminal 4 now (1:15pm) waiting for the 12:30 shuttle to Tucson.

I used Arizona Shuttle for the first time March of last year and was amazed at how easy it was.  Loved the waiting area (many seats) at the luggage claim (I flew into PHX on Southwest) where I could calmly wait for the shuttle to arrive.  A few days later, I took their shuttle from Prescott to Flagstaff to Grand Canyon.  There was some possible delays expected due to road work; they contacted me to arrange for a slightly earlier departure.  All went smoothly.  The drop-off/pick-up at the Amtrak is conveniently located to the downtown area of Flagstaff - great restaurants/cafes and shops within walking distance as I waited for the next shuttle to Grand Canyon.  This experience brought me back for more.  In November I booked reservations for March of 2015.  As I was looking over my confirms (now January) I see I in error did not in fact select March when scheduling online but rather still had it on November.  Thus, reservation was Nov 21 2014 and not March 21 2014.  Clearly my fault yet Arizona Shuttle allowed me to use my earlier payment for my March trip.  It was not their error at all; so, I don't know for sure why they were so kind, but this clearly warranted my taking time to write a review - and it was unsolicited.  Not once did the person on the other side of the phone as for a review.  It was just good business.

Whenever I go from PHX to Tucson or vice versa, I take the Arizona Shuttle over the Greyhound at any chance I get (DUHH). It's double the price, BUT OH SO WORTH IT. 

Service is always spot-on, they offer mini waters and have multiple convenient drop-off locations in Tucson. Shuttles are sometimes rattly, but otherwise are in great to good condition. I'd recommend taking AZ Shuttle for sure as I've never had any issues with them.

originally booked shuttle from Mesa Gateway Airport to my home in San Tan Valley, booked and paid return trip, received confirmation of trip and payment, the couple hours later were notified that they weren't allowed to wait at Mesa Airport for pick ups, and was told that a refund would be done by end of business day, been promised same thing now 4 times, and at a week since payment, don't know if whole company is crooked or just this one office, but tired of banging my head against wall. word of advice, stay away from this company, im guessing that this my be why they aren't allowed to use this airport any longer !!
Great service at a reasonable price. The service manager Brent is very helpful and professional.

I use to fly a lot but as the cost raises and terror took the skies I stopped. I however flew Alaska Airlines one way from Seattle to Phoenix to transport my beloved dog. They are still the best! Their pet transport fee is still the lowest when your pet travels at the same time you do. When I got to my seat there was a post-a-note saying I'm on board too! That reassured me, and others like me that our pet was on the plane. I thought that was such a sweet and thoughtful touch. Kudos Alaska Airline! I flew you also because many trips between Seattle and Alaska with my prior dog had been successful and horror free. You know how to take care of our fury members, as well as the rest of us and you do it at fairer fare than the others.
Your cleaning staff is awesome after the flight they get in there and tidy things up for the next group, find and turn in our forgotten items like my L.G. Lotus phone and quickly get it to us before we leave the airport! When I went to claim my baggage and dog your porter took the work out of it by having all my belongings and my dog gathered and ready to go curbside for my pick up! The porter  checked to make sure my dog was mine and even minded my bags while I took my dog to the PHX doggie walk at the airport to relieve herself! All in all I felt I and my canine companion were looked out for like we were more than just a head count  from the start to the end of the trip. Further more all my belongings including my computer and camera equipment in my checked in baggage came to me undisturbed and undamaged. I thank you a thousand times for your kid gloves to my personal belongings and with my dog. I'll be flying with you again.
Very friendly on air staff and both flights landed early!  That's the best! Downside was our flight didn't have a movie and you have to pay to use the wifi.

Simply the best, I just wish they flew to more places out of Phoenix!  Going out of Terminal 2 is easy and convenient, the people are friendly, the planes are clean and new (unlike the garbage on Southwest and USAirways), and their ticket prices are reasonable.   Definitely worth trying if you've never flown them before.  I'm a fan!

I've had a number of very poor customer service experiences with Alaska. I was making a connecting flight in Seattle to Bellingham (45 min flight from Seattle), however, my family had come down to Seattle for the day and we decided I would just miss my connection and drive back to Bellingham with them. WRONG. I called Alaska as a courtesy to tell them I wasn't going to be on the plane, and they told me my returning flights would be cancelled if I didn't make the connection (as in physically sit on the plane). I wasn't asking for a refund on the ticket, I was just saying my butt wasn't going to be in the seat on the Bellingham flight that I had already paid for. Customer service was incredibly rude and unhelpful. By the time I got off the phone with them it was too late to make the connection and I had to pay almost $300 extra to rebook the return flights. It was insane and illogical. 

While this is not a reflection of the entire flight crew, twice I've encountered rude and demeaning flight attendants or ticket counter employees which has tainted my experience as a whole. I'll be sticking to southwest from here on out, a cheap flight is not worth the hassle and bad attitudes.
Long lines. good cars, far from airport (well, the entire car rental depot is far!), friendly staff. That's about it!

We rented a car from National for our week in Sedona.  It was a 2010 or 11 Infiniti G37 and it worked just fine for the 3 of us.  There was a wait to check in for the car but it wasn't impossible and returning the car at the end of the week was quick and easy.  The rental car complex is a distance from the terminals, but shuttle buses circulate frequently and the ride is relatively short.  It's new and comfortable.  The art on display in the hallway on the way to the bathrooms was interesting and attractive.  The building is easy to navigate.  It was a good experience
Their van was was super clean, and drove great!!! They also helped us out in a pinch when we needed a van last minute. Awesome awesome, thank you!

I'm glad I ignored the one star rating given by another reviewer.  My experience with this company could not have been better.  I rented a 12 passenger van to take my family to Bearizona and everyone was pleased with the van and how clean and well-maintained it was.  The staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and easy to work with.  I also liked the fact that with copies of driver's licenses of the other adults on the trip, they were able also to drive the van without going into the office in person.  The price was very competitive, the supply and availability of vans plus the convenient hours of operation made this the absolute best choice.  I'll never go back to any other company when I need to rent a van!

Excellent company, van and service! Rented a 15 passenger van to take 11 family members up to flagstaff to go sledding and see Bearzona. Made a last minute reservation, Josh was very friendly on the phone and had no problem with a late reservation. Allowed us to pick the van up the evening before and drop off the morning after our day trip at no extra charge which was very helpful to us! Larry was very friendly and helpful at pickup/drop off. Van was very clean, well maintained and the tires were in great shape. Van also had a latch system for car seats which was perfect for us since we had three on our trip. Had no problems with the van at all! Would definitely rent from them again!

On behalf of Institute of Motion... I highly recommend this company! They are so accommodating and friendly and genuinely care about how to make your rental experience as easy as possible. We have used them for a few years now and I know they are cheaper than well-known companies (Hertz, Alamo, etc.). We rented 3 vans and they had us in and out in less than 30 minutes. The vans were clean and ready to drive off the lot. We had several options for dropping off after hours due to our time frame. This is a very well organized family business and they really go above and beyond to make renting vans an easy process. We will ALWAYS return to them for future events. Thank you A-1 for your exceptional service and for being patient with our constant schedule changes!!!!!

Rented a 15 passenger van for 6 adults, 4 children and 1 infant. Everyone and everything fit comfortably. Nice, clean, high visibility, safe ride. Every company member we encountered was professional, friendly and accommodating. We will definitely recommend and use this rental company again.

I didnt have the best experience.  I was given the hard sell on the car upgrade/insurance, the car had scratches all over it, and I returned it less than 2 hrs late and was charged for a full day.  That being said, I called management to report my concerns and I felt that they took them seriously.  They credited me for the extra day and indicated that they would try to fix the problem for the future.  I was impressed with the follow up customer service.

This was my first time renting from advantage. I don't think I'll do it again. The only reason for a 1 star rating is for the long line. Way too long for a car rental, took about an hour. Car is ok and price is good. But id rather pay a little extra for convenience.

got an old school bus but it was well worth the money had to use this as a last minute deal to Las Vegas the phoenix station was not too ghetto but you could tell it was not in the best area but the driver was hilarious some lady overslept and was supposed to go to bull head city wound up waking up in the vegas bus station and tried to flip out on the driver and he let her know haha but listen you gotta do what you gotta do sometime my seat was never snatched when i went to the rest room and my space was respected would suggest you take this as a last resort tho flying is wayyyy quicker ood luck

First time Greyhound rider here. --- Let's get that out of the wayI bought a bus ticket from LA to Phoenix in order to visit some friends for a few days from Dec. 26-28.  I thought that it was a big mistake after reading the mostly 1 and 2-star reviews of previously dissatisfied patrons.  

So the time came around [quick] for my return trip to Los Angeles and I was very reluctant to expect major delays and unprofessional staff, as previous patrons had experienced.  Much to my surprise, I experienced neither of the two.  The bus was perfectly on time and the staff was very helpful.  They must have been cheery due to the holidays.  I even had my own seat on the bus!!  The driver was very professional and hell-bent on sticking to the time schedule, which I liked a lot.  I'd say my experience on the LA Greyhound was good enough to try again.  I'd rate 5-stars but I don't think the experience was perfect.

This was the first time I was every at a bus station.  I found the staff very friendly, much more so that at the airport.  I was able to help my friend, get all his bags checked, although he had to remove his silverware???  

Anyway, I may never have to ride the bus, but if I do, I want the people that were working on this visit to be working them as well.

I am utterly and completely baffled why Greyhound sells tickets online since they don't guarantee you an actual seat on the bus.

My husband had a family member unexpectedly come into town his home town for a few days, and the most efficient way to quickly get him there from Phoenix was Greyhound.  Bought his ticket online and showed up at the Phoenix terminal this morning.

He was standing in line to get his bagged tagged and the woman in front of him was arguing with the tagger that she couldn't carry her own bag to the bus.  After a bit of back and forth, the tagger carried the bag for her, creating a few minute delay. During this time, several people without checked bags walked up to the counter, purchased tickets and boarded.  My husband finally got his bag tagged, went to board and was told nope, bus was full.  He, as well as the people behind him who had purchased advanced tickets, were not amused.

The next bus out was at 2:30AM (this was at 9AM) or they could route him a on a super scenic route that wouldn't get in until 11PM - well past when anyone could pick him up.  So, we'll try this again tomorrow, cutting his time with his family member by a day.

I contacted Greyhound via FB and was told they don't have a reservation system basically it's first come, first serve, even if you're standing in line with your ticket while they sell tickets to more people.

Okay, I can understand first come, first serve, but why on earth would they then sell tickets online with the date, time and bus number on them?  I'm pretty sure if my husband had missed this bus because of his error they wouldn't honor that ticket tomorrow so to me it seems like that ticket was for a seat on that bus and by issuing it, Greyhound needs to provide a seat.

Am I missing something?  Because their explanation made no sense.  If it's going to be first come, first serve then the ticket I bought should be good for one fare from Phoenix to Point B on any day at any time ~ first come, first serve!

We have no choice but to go this route this time if my husband wants to see this family member he hasn't seen in years, but for future trips, I'll consider all other options ~ heck, hitchhiking might have got him there faster with less frustration (not to mention the time lost from work getting him to/from the bus station!).

Very bad customer service! Evelyn in food section had terrible customer service, Kim in tickets was very rude!!!!! No one there smiles but one security guard. The rest looked liked they hated there job! No manners! No help! I'd rather pay tufesa or El Paso Los Angeles limo bus then these jerks!

I m giving it a 3 star rating many because after a bad experience at the Glendale's bus station this seems much better.

1. It's small and tidier than the last one. 
2. There is free wifi.
3. Proper place to sit.

Cons are 
Loud... Because of TVs, even though no one seems to be watching them.
Spectacular that in this day and age there exists a company that can stay afloat while not caring about their customers. MegaBus, please come to Arizona!

I'd give them zero stars if possible.  Flithy insect ridden station with an unhelpful staff who misdirected me, causing me to miss my bus and connecting train.  Two televisions five feet from each other blaring at high volume drowning out the pa system that must have been built by Thomas Edison himself and sounds like the adults in a Peanuts comic.  After this trip I am never getting on a bus again.

WOW!  I don't even know where to begin - and wish I could give ZERO stars!  One star is entirely too many!!!  Paid for my son to come from Amarillo, Texas, to Indio, California (I have a copy of the entire schedule) - again AMARILLO to INDIO!  The bus got to Phoenix, and there my son stayed!  There WAS NO BUS going to Indio, and he could receive no answers from the lady working behind the desk - evidently she was busy "chatting" with the security guard.  The bus my son was on, turned around and went to Tucson - not California!!!  While my son stood there, I tried to call the Phoenix bus station, and there was no answer.  I simply wanted to know when my son could board a bus to complete the rest of his trip, of which I paid for.  My son literally saw the lady ignore many incoming phone calls (5 of which were mine, before I finally gave up)!  As a result, my husband and I had to make a 9 hour round-trip "road trip" to pick up my son at the Phoenix bus station.  Will I be calling the main office of Greyhound demanding a partial refund? This is by far the worst Greyhound station I've ever been to! I've had great experiences in the past but this place is full of staff and bus drivers that are just not knowledgeable of anything.

First, I called ahead to make sure I got priority seating. They confirm what it's true on the website; that they had priority seating for the bus ride I was taking, which is an express ride. When I got there, the gentleman working the counter said there is no priority seating, and that my bag would not need a tag when I asked for one, saying it was super full. Her told me I didn't need one.

So I got in line and I asked the guy loading the cargo if he thought it would be better to throw it under. He also confirmed it would fit up top. I got on the bus, but wasn't priority seated, even with my stamped "A" ticket told me I should be one of the first people on the bus. I was 3rd to last. Yay for being next to the smelly piss for 16 hours.

On the bus I couldn't fit my bag on the overheas bin so I put it on the seat next to me. Tai, the bus driver, came over to argue with me to make sure it went up top despite the fact that he let another gentleman keep his bag on his accompanying seat. When I told him the desk clerk and the baggage loader both told me I didn't need a tag and that it would fit, and of course that it was my responsibility to get a tag, he called me "sweety" derogatorily. Thanks for your sexism, but I don't identify as female asshole. He then shoved my bag up top and made it fit by damaging the contents, stating, "See it does fit."

Then I found out only half of the electricity works on the bus and of course it's the half of the bus I'm sitting on. Didn't I pay for this wifi?! Icing on this shit cake.

Seriously difficult to deal with these people. They just really need to figure their shit out, so they don't lie to costumers one second just to have another employee say the opposite thing.
